title: Write the Equation in Standard Form
text: It can be written in the standard form $$\frac{x^2}{1}+\frac{y^2}{4}=1$$.

title: Determine Whether the Major Axis is Horizontal or Vertical
text: Since $$1<4$$ and $$4$$ is in the $$y^2$$ term, the major axis is horizontal.

title: Find the endpoints of the major axis.
text: The endpoints will be the y-intercept. Since $$b^2=4$$ then $$b=-2$$ or $$b=2$$. The endpoint of the major axis are $$(0,2)$$, $$(0,-2)$$.

title: Find the endpoints of the minor axis.
text: The endpoints will be the x-intercepts. Since $$a^2=1$$, then $$a=-1$$ or $$a=1$$. The endpoints of the minor axis are $$(1,0)$$, $$(-1,0)$$.

title: Elimination of Choices
text: The graph with y-intercepts $$(0,2)$$, $$(0,-2)$$ and x-intercepts $$(1,0)$$, $$(-1,0)$$ is the answer.
